item.description:
Every 2nd and 4th Friday evening is Dinner With Dharma at the Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center at 950 Massachusetts Avenue, between Central and Harvard Squares, Cambridge.

6:30 p.m. Meditation (Sitting and Breathing, led by a Buddhist nun or a leader in training) 
7:00 p.m. Dinner (vegan - but ALWAYS ask because it reminds them) 
Cost (Include vegan buffet dinner) PLEASE BRING CASH ONLY. THEY are unable to accept Credit Cards!! 
Adult: $10 Student: $5 (student ID required for the $5 half price)

7:45 p.m. Dharma Talk and Discussion (scheduled to finish around 9:00 pm)

Ravi Nathwani from San Franciso and Mombai, India  will discuss karma (identifiable regularities we can discover through observation and inductive thinking)

Program organized by Marjorie Jacobs, BU psychotherapist and married monastic in training - 'going clear' from being a JUU-Bu. 

They will provide Buddhist perspectives affirming the importance of OUR RESPONSIBLE ROLE in insight-building, pursuing understanding (a value taught in nearly all of the world's major religions), and cultivating those insights for modern living.

If you have any questions, please call the temple.

Take the T to Central Square,  http://www.mbta.com/rider_tools/trip_planner/
Walk in TOWARDS Harvard Square until you see 950 Mass Ave on the left (south) side of the street.

Please invite friends and family. If you have any questions, please call the GBBCC.

Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center - Omitofo for the event at GBBCC 
950 Massachusetts Avenue (#1 bus, between Red Line stops at Central Square and Harvard Square) 
Cambridge, MA 
617-547-6670

http://www.GBBC.net  - IF you speak and read Mandarin - Chinese language site has a security warning, but it's SAFE 
PHOTOS of the Buddhist Tea House interior 
http://www.yelp.com/biz/greater-boston-buddhist-cultural-center-cambridge

http://bit.ly/GBBCC-Intro-Mandarin - Mandarin language intro to Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center in Cambridge, MA

For driving directions please check here 
http://bit.ly/dByxK8  - Google Maps of the Area with GBBCC
http://pluralism.org/profiles/view/74842  - HDS Pluralism Project Profile-Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center (GBBCC) - includes history and statistics

We look forward to seeing you there! We'll be there from 6:30pm to 8:30pm, maybe 10 pm, if we like the talk(s).

For more info. for this place, please check GBBCC photo  site and Maynard's pictures of the place  http://pluralism.org/photosets/view/189  and  http://bit.ly/GBBCC-Photos
